ratings.comment: Prof. Friedland is funny guy, and it's clear he's passionate about the material and very knowledgeable. There's a lot of reading for this class (around 100 or so pages a week), but it's manageable if you're interested in the material. Make sure to show up to lecture because he goes through the main points of the readings.

Thought this class was pretty good, but there were a ton of dry readings, I often ended up skimming or skipping the weekly readings unless I was required to speak on them. Lectures were interesting, learned a lot about journalism and mass comm. Lots of papers to write and the most important ones were pretty hard to write. Decent course overall.

Professor Friedland was really nice when he was outside of class and really helpful about papers and course material. However, he didn't teach J201 with the spunk it could have been taught with. The midterms are harder than expected, but all the material you will be tested on is on the slides he posts on the web. Overall, this is an Easy A.

Lew was and alright professor, but his lectures were pretty boring and he was not approachable at all. He acted like everyone in the class was dumb and didn't understand anything. I stopped paying attention completely by the end. However, I had a wonderful TA who made the papers and speeches absolutely painless, so it was a great Com-B.

Kind of disappointed in this class. I was super interested in the topic but feel as if I didn't get what I expected/hoped. Concepts were confusing and hard to understand, as well as lecture slides. Lew was monotone so it was hard to pay attention. This class isn't cake but not hard- you still have to put in work and do good on papers & exams.

Lew was a pretty good lecturer, but he could stand to be a little less monotone and dry with his delivery. One thing that frustrated me was the inconsistency of the course. Half the time, we had guest lecturers - Professor Friedland could have very well lectured on these topics. This made for a somewhat disorganized course but overall Lew is solid.

Lew is opinionated and his lectures are disorganized. The TAs never seemed to be on the same page with him. The material itself wasn't difficult to grasp, but the way Lew presented made it much more complicated than it needed to be.

Lew is a pretty good professor if you agree with absolutely everything that he says. He's extremely opinionated and has a severe superiority complex, which makes his lectures, which are incredibly boring, even worse. Absolutely dreaded the class every morning, even though it was easy. Paper topics were dumb but simple. The grading rubric was awful.

Everything about this class was dry. Lectures were very boring (the guest lectures were more exciting than Lew's ramblings). The essay's were about boring topics, and the readings were shockingly boring as well. The exam's were incredibly nitpicky and not about what he made seem to be the "key class topics". Would not take again.

2 exams, 2 long essays, 5 short writing  assignments, 5 quizzes. Friedland's class is boring, but if you go through all the lecture slides (available online) and readings carefully, you will get at lest AB in this course. The exams are difficult, but writing assignments are easy. TA is really helpful!

Really boring class/not what expected. Material is easy, but he makes is complicated. His lectures don't say much, but still will be confused if don't go/not much on lecture slides online. Papers assigned are on uninteresting topics. He seems kind of rude sometimes as well. Don't really need to read the readings.

Honestly not a fan of this class. Some aspects are interesting because it analyzes the media you use in your everyday life, but the exams were not as "common sense" as the lectures made the concepts seem. Most of the guest speakers are better than his lectures. The only thing that kept me from dropping it was the Comm. B requirement and a good TA.

Lew is the best! He's extremely knowledgable and really easy going. He also really cares about neighborhood beats and local reporting, which is great. One of the best professors in the J school, and I'm so lucky to have had him. Also, he gives a great powerpoint lecture on getting a job -SO useful!

I didn't like him at all.  Lets his political opinions enter the classroom way too much.  We had a few lectures that consisted solely of him talking about how much he hates the governor and "informing us" on state government instead of covering the assigned material.  He's also pompous and the class is boring.

Lew is an amazing professor that will change your outlook on media. If you have the chance, have him for discussion.  Very approachable and doesn't have a superiority complex like other UW professors. Very smart guy with a true passion for teaching.

This 561 class was just ok.  Prof. Friedland was extremely helpful and took time to talk about the financial crisis/bailouts on days when there was big news, which was interesting and useful.  Friedland is a nice guy and a good professor, but his class was kind of bland.
Has a way of relating things academic and historic to everyday, modern life. Has a calm demeanor, an incredible brain and an apparent shyness that is utterly beguiling. All the chicks dig him.
